title: Unity launches visionOS beta, opening the doors for existing apps and games
description: A closed beta will admit developers gradually over the coming weeks.

title: Study claims ChatGPT is losing capability, but some experts aren’t convinced
description: Either way, experts think OpenAI should be less opaque about its AI model architecture.

title: Google’s new security pilot program will ban employee Internet access
description: You can't get hacked if you aren't on the Internet.

title: Florida malaria outbreak still going with local cases now at 7
description: Local officials are still working to apply insecticide by air, trucks, and crews.

title: FTC rewrites rules on Big Tech mergers with aim to ease monopoly-busting
description: Merger rules currently stacked in favor of monopolists, critics say.

title: Attackers find new ways to deliver DDoSes with “alarming” sophistication
description: Once crude and unsophisticated, DDoSes are now on par with those by nation-states.

title: AT&T says lead cables in Lake Tahoe “pose no danger” and should stay in place
description: AT&T may have nearly 200,000 miles of lead-covered phone cables across US.

title: Something in space has been lighting up every 20 minutes since 1988
description: We have no explanations for this sort of slow repeat.

title: The Cyber Trust Mark is a voluntary IoT label coming in 2024. What does it mean?
description: The FCC and other agencies have their hands full trying to simplify a big topic.

title: Netflix kills Basic plan, making its cheapest ad-free tier $15.49
description: If you already have the $9.99 Basic plan, you can keep it.

title: Nissan is the next automaker to adopt Tesla-style EV charging plugs
description: From 2024, Nissan Ariyas will be able to use an adapter to charge at Superchargers.

title: US military leans into megaconstellations after their “resiliency” in Ukraine
description: "Having a megaconstellation, quite frankly, frustrates our adversaries."

title: Asus takes over everything about Intel’s current and future NUC mini PCs
description: "Non-exclusive license" lets Asus sell current NUC designs and make new ones.

title: DC fits fleet of EVs with bogus gadget promising 60% range boost
description: The Energy Management Module claims it can "rejuvenate a battery" somehow.

title: Pikmin 4 review: Falling in love with micromanagement
description: You've never had so much fun keeping 100 unruly children on task.

title: Prime Video drops Wheel of Time S2 trailer ahead of San Diego Comic-Con
description: "You're not a spoke, boy. You are the water that turns the wheel itself."

title: Fear, loathing, and excitement as Threads adopts open standard used by Mastodon
description: Meta promised to make Threads compatible with W3C open standard for social media.

title: Behind the scenes: How we host Ars Technica, part 1
description: Join us on a multipart journey into our place in cloud!

title: NASA starts building ice-hunting Moon rover
description: VIPER is NASA’s first rover that needs headlights.
